original: LEIJONHUFVUD, Stig Abraham, Friherre, Bergsingenjör, Äppelviken, f V :a Ryd, Upps 1. 27/11 00 av domänintendent friherre E G L o frih:an Louise Rålamb, gm Luisa Forabosco. Studex Upps 20, bergsingex KTH 26. Vik lär v bergssk i Falun 27, Jernkont :s stip i Österr 0 Tyskl 27—28, anst i bergsing.fma Hytten-berg Sthlm 28—29, lab.chef v J & C G Bolinders Mek Verkst AB 29—33, forskn.resa t Engl, v Bolinders Fabr AB 33—34, ass o konsult injr 1 fma Volator, Lundberg & Co, Sthlm 34—35. ensamrepr i Sthlm f fma Meyerhofer & Co i Zurich samt f Elex AG där sed. 36 und eg fma. Av trycket: Medarb i Beyer-Desimons Flughafenanlagen (30), i Sv Tekn Uppslagsbok II, kap Ugnar (39), upps i tekn tidskr. Specialitet: Ugnsteknik o gasrening. Led Sv Tekn.frn.
translated: LEIJONHUFVUD, Stig Abraham, Baron, Mining Engineer, Äppelviken, born in Ryd, Uppsala, on November 27th, 1900, son of Estate Superintendent Baron E.G.L. Leijonhufvud and Baroness Louise Rålamb, married to Luisa Forabosco. Studied at Uppsala University in 1920, became a mining engineer at the Royal Institute of Technology in Stockholm in 1926. Worked as a teacher at the Bergsskolan in Falun in 1927, held a scholarship from Jernkont for studies in Austria and Germany from 1927 to 1928, employed at the engineering firm Hyttenberg in Stockholm from 1928 to 1929, lab manager at J&C G Bolinders Mechanical Works AB from 1929 to 1933, conducted research trips to England for Bolinders Fabr AB from 1933 to 1934, and worked as an assistant and consultant engineer for the company Volator, Lundberg & Co in Stockholm from 1934 to 1935. Sole representative in Stockholm for Meyerhofer & Co in Zurich and for Elex AG since 1936 in his own business. Published works include contributions to Beyer-Desimon's Airfield Facilities (1930), the Swedish Technical Encyclopedia II, chapter on ovens (1939), and articles in technical journals. Specialized in oven technology and gas purification. Member of the Swedish Engineering Society.
